reference.shortdesc: The glossSynonym element provides a term that is a synonym of the term but is not an abbreviated form.

section.title: Usage information
section.note: A list of synonyms is specific to the language, so translation of a glossentry topic might result in an empty glossSynonym element.
section.draft-comment: I agree with most comments about language distinctions, but I would think that synonyms would exist in all languages. they might not be the same synonyms (ie translations of the listed synonyms in one language), but I would still think there would be synonyms.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The glossSynonym element is specialized from title. It is defined in the glossary entry module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the glossSynonym element can be used to identify a synonym for the primary term:
example.codeblock: <glossentry id="automobile"> <glossterm>Automobile</glossterm> <glossdef>A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or an electric motor.</glossdef> <glossBody> <glossAlt> <glossSynonym>car</glossSynonym> </glossAlt> </glossBody> </glossentry>
